data.title: Fixed a typo in the Xamarin Studio Addin
data.body:
The code that was injecting the monogame .props file
had a tyyo in the Codition property. This was causing
the build to fail on Windows.

This commit fixes that issue

data.title: graphics.ApplyChanges() exiting app in monoMac
Fixed Minimum framework version for iOS
data.body:
The Minumum framework version needs to be 5.1.1 in order to
compile the iOS app. It also needs to be that version to publish
to the maximum number of devices.

data.title: Window class has no effect
data.body: Both Window.Is Borderless and Window.Position do not change the window

data.title: Pipeline tool and PNG with transparency (windows)
data.body:
Adding a PNG file without transparency is ok and all three options are available (copy, add link, skip).
Adding a PNG WITH transparency is not ok and the first option is not available (copy radio button is disabled).
Adding item with link doesn't work at all as Content.Load() raise an exception.

PNG created with Gimp 2.8.16 (last stable binary release) with the exact same options (only "save creation time", "save color values for transparent pixels", compression level 8), saved to a directory outside the solution.
the PNG without transparency have a single colour background, the PNG with it doesn't have any background colour at all.

If option "save color values for transp. pixels" is not used, PNG import have the "copy" option enabled.
But it looks like image doesn't have transparency (transparent background replaced by black background).

Tested on both pipeline version 3.4.0.56 and recent dev version, same behaviour.

data.title: Pipeline 3.4.0.455 not processing wav or mp3 file (MacOSX)
data.body:
I tried the GUI and it complain with:

```
Build failed:  ApplicationName='mono', CommandLine='"/Volumes/HDD/Applications/Pipeline.app/Contents/MonoBundle/MGCB.exe" /@:"/Users/ambs/Desktop/TESTE.mgcb" ', CurrentDirectory='/Users/ambs/Desktop', Native error= Cannot find the specified file
```

When running manually (not sure if options are completely correct) I got:

```
mono /Volumes/HDD/Applications/Pipeline.app/Contents/MonoBundle/MGCB.exe /platform:macosx /build:POL-macaron-island-short.wav
-----
chmod: Unable to change file mode on /Volumes/HDD/Applications/Pipeline.app/Contents/MonoBundle/ffmpeg: Operation not permitted
```

after fixing, it complained yet again

```
chmod: Unable to change file mode on /Volumes/HDD/Applications/Pipeline.app/Contents/MonoBundle/ffprobe: Operation not permitted
```

Fixed it again, and the command line succeeded, creating a .xnb file (didn't test it yet, though).

In any case, the GUI continues failing.

Hints?

(those permissions should be fixed during instalation, though).

Happy to give further details if needed.

data.title: Fix the MonoMac Template so it runs
data.body:
The MonoMac project was missing a MainMenu item
which was causing the application to crash.
Has to add back the use of Nuget because MonoMac projects
to NOT use MSBuild/xbuild so it cannot use the new .props
system.

data.title: Run Installer Update
data.body:
Does 2 things:
- Makes ffmpeg and ffprobe executable after installation
- Removes automatic dependency installer and adds a list of packages that are needed... much better since we won't have to add per distro stuff do the installer, chances are the people were running a distro that we didn't have automatic dep installer for, plus now people will get the list of needed packages during the install process

CC. @dellis1972

data.title: Planning for Vulkan, DirectX 12, and Metal

milestone.title: 4.0 Release
milestone.description: Major new API to support the new graphics libraries like Metal, Vulkan, and DirectX 12.

data.body:
We need to plan how we want to approach supporting the new graphics APIs:  Vulkan, DirectX 12, and Metal.

These new APIs are more verbose and require more setup code to do similar things as previous graphics libraries.  This makes MonoGame even more useful to developers if we support them well.

We should consider this work in two steps:
- Implement new graphics backends within our existing XNA style API.
- Design and implement a new API that fits these new graphics standards.

The most immediate thing would be shoehorning these into our existing XNA style APIs.  There are potentially (I will know for sure soon) some performance benefits to be gained just by doing that.  Likely this will also require support in the content pipeline for new shader formats as well.

The next bigger step is designing a new graphics API for MonoGame that better aligns with Vulkan/DX12/Metal features.  It would be nice to support both this new API and our existing one at the same time, but we could just make a clean break if we feel confident about it.

data.title: Remove PerformanceCounter
data.body: Fixes #4518

data.title: Remove VertexPosition2ColorTexture and VertexColorTexture, and add VertexPosition
data.body: Implements #4494

data.title: Implement vertexStride in VertexBuffer.SetData for OpenGL

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This does for OpenGL what #3356 did for DirectX.

Previously, it would only have worked when `vertexStride == sizeof(T)`. This code path remains unchanged. The new code is for when `vertexStride != sizeof(T)`.

This change is covered by existing tests in `VertexBufferTest`: `SetPosition` and `SetTextureCoordinate`. These tests previously failed for OpenGL, and they now pass.

data.title: Add Geometry Shader Support
data.body: Extend the Effect system and pipeline to support geometry shaders (possibly hull and domain shaders as well).  We need to see what support for these other shader stages is under various platforms and decide what platform we can support.

data.title: [OpenTK / SDL2] Input swapped if more than 2 brands of gamepad are plugged
data.body:
When using the SDL2 backend, if one plugs multiple gamepads with at least one gamepad of a different brand than the others, this gamepad will have its mapping swapped with one of the other.

For instance, if I have 2 Xbox 360 gamepads and 1 PS4 gamepads plugged:
- Xbox 360 n°1 will be OK
- Xbox 360 n°2 will be recognized as PS4
- PS4 will be recognized as Xbox 360

Thanks @endimilojkoski for reporting this.

data.title: Make BitmapContent Width and Height setters protected
data.body:
Make BitmapContent Width and Height setters protected. Fixes #4560.

Despite what MSDN [says](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.bitmapcontent.width.aspx), XNA's `BitmapContent` does not have public `Width` and `Height` setters.

data.title: [MD Templates] Improved Program.cs and Game1.cs
data.body:
Stuff done:
- files were full of both tabs and spaces, so replaced tabs with spaces
- there were also tabs/spaces at the end of some lines... removed those
- game will now start windowed by default
- Program.cs is now calling the game withing `using` block

CC. @dellis1972

data.title: Remove EnsureExecutable method
data.body:
In case the user does not have the correct permissions to use chmod on the file, this will cause a crash(try catch can't stop it). In short this means audio can't be compiled because code tries to set +x permissions onto ffmpeg(even tho it already had them).

Considering we are using this check only for calling 2 ffmpeg files, this check is meaningless since Installers are already setting correct permissions.

CC. @dellis1972

data.title: Missing VS iOS project template
data.body: The current VS project templates include Windows and Android. There is a noticeable absence of iOS/Mac OS.

data.title: Font Style Renderer
data.body:
I'm working on methods to create the font styles manually for fonts where we can't find a font with the style included. This is complimentary to my pulls #4537 and #4545 (may have conflicts with this one).
This is the result of my first version
![embolden and italic first pass](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11319966/13269807/22815e48-da8a-11e5-946b-b4e1d6fc59cb.PNG)
Both texts are taken from the regular arial font, and the big one is emboldened and italiced, while the second one is only emboldened. In theory the first one should have been only italiced, but there's a problem with `FontDescriptionStyle` and the `Bold` flag is always set.

For the italiced effect i'm skewing the characters about 20 degrees.
For the emboldened effect i'm drawing the bitmap 3 times with 1 pixel offset each one.

I still have to review the spacing of the characters as the italics are drawn outside it's reported size horizontally (vertically the problem is resolved in #4545 as that comes from other place)

data.title: Possible bug in PixelBitmapContent.cs
data.body:
I have been working on the renderer for font styles and was trying to reuse the current instance of `BitmapContent`. The problem arised when I tried to resize the bitmap, I began getting exceptions when calling `BitmapContent.SetPixelData(byte[])` because after setting the new size, the data array still has the old size.
First I thought that he properties `Width` and `Height` should be read only, but looking into the XNA documentation both of them are read and write properties.
Then I looked into the property implementation, and it does nothing apart from changing the corresponding field.
And last I saw the data container that is defined in this case in `PixelBitmapContent`, it is a jagged array with an array for the rows that contains more arrays for the data of each row. This makes enlarging the width or the height make the data wrong, and method `GetPixelData` and `SetPixelData` prone to memory corruption.

Also looking at other siblings of `PixelBitmapContent` like `DxtBitmapContent` or `Etc1BitmapContent` use a simple byte array for the data.

data.title: [Documentation] Getting Started
data.body: This was very painful :|

data.title: Pipeline GUI Automated Testing
data.body:
We need to develop or find a solution to effectively automate the testing of the GUI Pipeline tool.  We should be able to write scripts/record macros that perform common tasks, have the test runner execute them, and verify the GUI produced the expected results.

This is critical in making the tool reliable.

Ideally the solution is cross platform and we can run most of the same tests without modifications on Mac and Linux as well.

data.body: During the DrawString instead of drawing '█', it draws a ' ' instead.

data.title: Vsync doesn't work on monogame 3.5 windowed applications [DesktopGL, Mac]
data.body:
I started a new DesktopGL project on my mac and I wanted to check fps so I did 
`Console.WriteLine(1 / deltaTime);`

Ive got fixed timestep set to false and Vsync to true : 

`IsFixedTimeStep = false;`
`graphics.SynchronizeWithVerticalRetrace = true;`

This is the result as you can see everything was fine at the start but after a while the vsync just turned off and the fps went from 60 to about 8000.
